text: you're scrolling through your phone or
computer and then spending evenings in
front of your TV just to end up falling
asleep late and waking up the next
morning even later no matter how many
hours of sleep you get you wake up
feeling exhausted without motivation and
just bored bored with life and how it's
currently moving or worse you feel like
you're existing through life and not
actually living it if that's how you're
feeling lately then you're clearly in a
rut this rut may be caused by a number
of factors including burnout depression
and chronic stress just to name a few
being in this state is uncomfortable
mostly because you want to live a
fulfilling happy life but you just don't
know how to get there and no manual
formula or magic spell can get you out
of feeling this way so here are a few
things that can hopefully help you crawl
out of this suffocating space one
understand and accept yourself an
important step to getting out of a rut
is to understand your value for many of
us our selfworth is tied to external
things like jobs productivity and
accomplishments when you set your
expectation so impossibly high you might
only end up knocking yourself down when
you don't achieve them this in turn
affects your self-esteem and can cause
you to lose your motivation in the
process loss of motivation can look
different from many people but the most
obvious signs start with your health
that's why the first thing you need to
do is assess how you
are are you eating well getting enough
sleep and doing things that you actually
want to do if something is lacking in
those departments address them but not
by belittling yourself be kind and
repair the areas you might have ignored
accept yourself for who you are right
now and know that not everyone has
everything together and that we all at
some point have been a mess so it's
okay accepting yourself might sound easy
but it involves conscious effort one
thing you can try is to write down
everything you did right it doesn't have
to be big it could be something simple
like complimenting or helping someone
learning to find the good things can
help reframe your thinking where you'll
slowly realize that your worth lies
Beyond quantitative measures two
rest resting is necessary but when
you're in a rut time spent resting can
feel like time wasted although you may
feel like scrolling through your phone
is resting it isn't in fact it's a
response to stress where you're so
overwhelmed that you scroll on your
phone to distract your mind and feel
safe when you take time to actually rest
you'll feel a lot different why well
your mind finally has the time to unwind
and not be in a constant state of panic
trying to process so many things at once
so treat yourself as if you have a cold
if you still have trouble resting try
meditation and mindfulness techniques to
help you relax these techniques can be
anything from taking daily walks
sunbathing deep breathing or even just
getting some movement as hard as it is
to believe resting and self-care are
actually the most productive things you
can do three social
connection let's face it social media
and real social connections are not the
same while they both provide connection
meeting a person face to face and
texting them have different benefits
spending time with someone who just gets
you and lifts your mood is therapeutic
and necessary when you're in a rette
without having these social connections
you may start struggling mentally
research from Tain University asserts
that a lack of social connections
distances you from your own feelings if
you don't have or are afraid of talking
to someone about your personal issues
reach out to a licensed therapist for
help going to therapy will help you not
only address the problems you struggle
with but will also help you open up to
others four break up with social media
social media can never replace true
social connection yet we've come to use
it as a replacement so learn to take
breaks from social media or depending on
what you feel comfortable with delete it
all together taking breaks from social
media will help you be more present in
your own life because most of the
content we view feeds into our
unrealistic expectations for ourselves
and makes us miss out on the beauty of
life also there's way too much
information online and your brain can't
keep up or to write it in a gratitude
Journal both will help you become more
receptive to positive changes in your
life six focus on one thing at a time
everything has a process and
consequently takes time but we're so
busy focusing on what lies ahead that we
get overwhelmed by the things we can do
right now so just worry about the next
step a great way to narrow your focus is
by writing down what you can and want to
do and I'm not talking about big distant
goals that only exist in the future what
are your next steps in your morning
routine what is look like write down the
steps that you actually do and usually
end up doing for example one wake up two
brush teeth three make bed etc focus on
achievable and real next steps it's how
you'll end up reaching big far off goals
if you feel like you want to improve
your next steps and habits check out our
video on micro habit and remember to
start
small seven get out of your head we
constantly live inside our heads
worrying and ruminating over the past
and the future so to see the bigger
picture and to get out of your rut you
must get out of your head a great way is
to work out working out not with the
purpose of meeting your fitness goals
but rather as a way to still your mind
and focus can be therapeutic exercise
releases endorphins which help you feel
better on the plus side you get to go
outside and the immediate blast of
something light will more often than not
brighten up your mood and make you feel
better so go out touch some grass and
move life is so much better when you're
living it not watching
it we often find ourselves in a rut
because we compare ourselves to others
into the idealized versions of who we
want to be so much so that we become
overwhelmed but remember there is a
process in becoming the best version of
yourself TJ
